metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5340 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Zend/zend_hash.c in PHP before 7.0.15 and 7.1.x before 7.1.1 mishandles certain cases that require large array allocations, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (integer overflow, uninitialized memory access, and use of arbitrary destructor function pointers) via crafted serialized data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5340` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
php7.0 - 7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
